revision.text: Possibly: An essay upon study. Wherein directions are given for the due conduct thereof, and the collection of a library, proper for the purpose, consisting of the choicest books in all the several parts of learning. By John Clarke, Master of the publick grammar school in Hull. (London : Printed for Arthur Bettesworth at the Red Lion in Pater-Noster Row, 1731). http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/976019891
